reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General provides written reports on an ongoing basis to the council every six months, with the first report due no later than 1 January 2012
summary:

7. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
The Prime Minister of Iraq, Nuri Kamel al-Maliki, wrote to the President of the Security Council, referencing his previous letter of 13 December 2009. He stated that the Government of Iraq aimed to put in place arrangements for the Development Fund for Iraq and the International Advisory and Monitoring Board, ensuring equitable use of oil revenue for the Iraqi people. 
The Government of Iraq submitted quarterly reports on the transition to successor arrangements, detailing progress and delays, citing the formation of a new Government after legislative elections on 7 March 2010. 
The Government of Iraq requests the Security Council's assistance to extend immunity for the Development Fund for Iraq for a final six months, until 30 June 2011, under the arrangements set forth in Security Council resolution 1483 (2003), paragraph 20. 
The Prime Minister requested circulation of his letter to Council members and inclusion as an annex to the resolution on Iraq.
